The Internet enables people to type recognizable names into a web browser in order to browse to a site (e.g., www.yourdomain.com). However, each site actually resides on a specific web server machine that is represented by a numeric IP address. Each IP address is a unique string of numbers separated by periods (e.g. 123.123.123.123) that identifies each computer or device connected to the Internet. This long number is much harder for humans to remember.
